Assemble TOP training data for all TF x cell type combos, then split training data into 10 partitions.

Source: R/assemble_training_data.R
assemble_TOP_training_data.Rd

Assemble TOP training data for all TF x cell type combos, then split training data into 10 partitions.

assemble_TOP_training_data(
  tf_cell_table_file,
  logistic.model = FALSE,
  chip_colname = "chip",
  training_chrs = paste0("chr", seq(1, 21, 2)),
  n.partitions = 10,
  max.sites = 50000,
  seed = 1
)

Arguments

tf_cell_table_file

a tab delimited file with three columns: TF names, cell types, and paths to the training data files.

logistic.model

If TRUE, use logistic version of the model

chip_colname

The column name of ChIP data in the combined data.

training_chrs

Chromosomes used for training the model.

n.partitions

split the data into partitions (default = 10) to run Gibbs sampling in parallel.

max.sites

Max number of candidate sites in each partition.

seed

seed used when sampling sites.

Contents
